title: Amid Techie Atul Subhash's Suicide, Amid Techie Suicide Case, Supreme Court Lays Down 8 Factors For Deciding Alimony
selftext: As always we need something drastic for something to happen . This should ideally come from the lawmakers where they should ensure the law is neutral and not to be misused by any litigant
comments: Laws are laid in India so that corrupt officers, corrupt judges can twist them and take bribes. This is India. After nirbhaya laws were made as if that has been deterrent for brutal rapes.

Alimony law is indeed gender neutral, at least for Hindu and Parsi marriages. But lower courts tend to not follow through on husbands' alimony claims. In 2014 the SC also laid down a 25% of income limit on monthly alimony. Again, not sure how often that limit is maintained in judgements by lower courts. Would be good to see stats on that, actually, but I couldn't find anything.
True enforcement of the law as stated should happen.. No point in just drafting and passing laws....
It’s us. The problem is us citizens who vote criminals to power. They take everything downhill with them.
